alert.note: Alert for Humphreys; Issaquena; Sharkey; Sunflower; Washington (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 8:38AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Chicot and southeastern Ashley Counties, northern Morehouse, northeastern East Carroll and West Carroll Parishes, southern Sunflower, Washington, northwestern Issaquena, northwestern Humphreys and northwestern Sharkey Counties through 915 AM CDT... At 838 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles west of Greenville to near Parkdale to near Bastrop. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Greenville around 845 AM CDT. Kilbourne and Wayside around 850 AM CDT. Leland, Eudora, Arcola and Gassoway around 855 AM CDT. Tribbett around 900 AM CDT. Goodwill and Darlove around 905 AM CDT. Glen Allan, Pioneer and Darnell around 910 AM CDT. Oak Grove, Inverness, Isola, Forest, Panther Burn and Grace around 915 AM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. High winds can bring down trees and large limbs resulting in serious injury or property damage. Exercise extreme caution when outdoors during such strong winds...and be especially aware of older trees. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
